verses.roman:
naimittikaḥ prākṛtiko
nitya ātyantiko layaḥ
saṁstheti kavibhiḥ proktaś
caturdhāsya svabhāvataḥ

synonyms: naimittikaḥ—occasional; prākṛtikaḥ—elemental; nityaḥ—continuous; ātyantikaḥ—ultimate; layaḥ—annihilation; saṁsthā—the dissolution; iti—thus; kavibhiḥ—by learned scholars; proktaḥ—described; caturdhā—in four aspects; asya—of this universe; svabhāvataḥ—by the inherent energy of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
translation: There are four types of cosmic annihilation—occasional, elemental, continuous and ultimate—all of which are effected by the inherent potency of the Supreme Lord. Learned scholars have designated this topic dissolution.
